alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Warren; Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central New York and eastern New York, including the following counties, in east central New York, Warren and Washington. In eastern New York, Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warrensburg, Whitehall, Johnsburg, Hague, Chestertown, Bolton Landing, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Huletts Landing, North Creek, Rogers Rock Campground, Comstock, Putnam, Mount Hope, Bolton, Wright, Thurman, Hampton, Riverbank and Darrowsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
